definition: back (of a human or other vertebrate, or of an object)
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder
ministry/department/section/part/division/troops/board/classifier for works of literature, films, machines etc

sentences.english: Floor bridge. Lie on your back with legs bent and your feet flat on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 背部着地平躺，两腿弯曲，脚平放在地上。

sentences.english: It works better if the blade's back edge (spine) somewhat touches the inner back edge of the scabbard while drawing out (same while inserting in).
sentences.chinese: 如果刀背略微贴着刀削的背部拔出会更好，插入亦然。

sentences.english: Dirk Kuyt and David Ngog are battling calf and back injuries respectively.
sentences.chinese: 库伊特小腿有伤，恩格格则遭遇背部伤病。

sentences.english: Our back opening nightwear is particularly popular for the management of night time incontinence.
sentences.chinese: 我们的背部开睡衣是特别受欢迎失禁时间管理的夜晚。

sentences.english: Similarly, bike riders often suffer from shoulder and back injuries and saddle-soreness.
sentences.chinese: 同样的，骑车者也被肩，背部疼痛和氨酸痛所折磨着。

sentences.english: A disc problem in the back, more heart trouble, a lens implant for cataracts.
sentences.chinese: 背部椎间盘问题，心脏问题，白内障晶体移植。

sentences.english: Buckwheat Hull Pillows are good for back, side and stomach sleepers.
sentences.chinese: 荞麦壳枕头可治疗背部和腹部一边熟睡。

sentences.english: They are a series of surface piercings arranged up the back in two vertical columns.
sentences.chinese: 由背部一组两列竖排表面穿环组成。

sentences.english: Firm the shoulder blades against the back, and move the sternum toward the chin.
sentences.chinese: 固定肩胛骨进入背部，移动胸骨向下巴的方向。

sentences.english: I hurt my head and my back.
sentences.chinese: 我的头部和背部都受了伤。

sentences.english: A special bag was connected to the tube for collecting bile.
sentences.chinese: 胆总管内置引流管引至大鼠颈背部，外接引流袋。

sentences.english: The doctor said my back was hurt because my spinal core was inflamed.
sentences.chinese: 医生说我背部痛是因为我脊椎神经发炎了。

sentences.english: The man's hands were tied behind his back.
sentences.chinese: 该名男子的双手被反绑在背后他的背部。

sentences.english: Epaulettes, belted waist and cuffs, central back vent.
sentences.chinese: 肩饰，腰部和袖口束带，背部开褶中心透气位。

sentences.english: The strap of this watch simply threads through the back of the face, and so can easily be changed.
sentences.chinese: 表带以很简单的方式穿过表背部，因而可方便替换。

definition: the back (human anatomy)/the back part of sth
the four limbs of the body
